casebody.data:
CITY OF NEW YORK v. SLOAT et al. (Supreme Court, Appellate Division, Second Department. June 29, 1905.) Appeal from Special Térm. In the matter of the application of the city of New York for a writ of certiorari to Elbert Sloat and others as assessors of the town of Carmel, county of Putnam, etc. From an adverse judgment and order, the city appeals. Affirmed.

Argued before HIRSCHBERG, P. J., and BARTLETT, WOODWARD, JENKS, HOOKER, RICH, and MILLER, JJ.

John J. Delany, Corp. Counsel, and I. J. Beaudrias, for appellant. George E. Anderson and Clayton Ryder, for respondents. PER CURIAM.

Order and judgment affirmed, with costs, on the opinion of Mr. Justice Keogh at Special Term. See 94 N. Y. Supp. 1111.
